TITLE: WA couple charged with illegally entering US Capitol during Jan. 6 protest
SUMMARY: A husband and wife were both charged with illegally entering the U.S. Capitol during the Jan. 6 protest. The Washington couple was ordered to appear before a judge to enter pleas.

TITLE: 5 apply for upcoming vacancy in Tennessee Supreme Court
SUMMARY: Five people have applied for the upcoming vacancy in the Tennessee Supreme Court. The Tennessee Governor’s Council for Judicial Appointments interview applicants Jan. 4.

TITLE: Richmond, VA, removes its last Confederate statue
SUMMARY: The monument of Gen. A.P. Hill was removed Monday, more than two years after Richmond, Virginia, began to purge itself of symbols representing racial oppression.

TITLE: Seattle investigates officer who allegedly used police equipment to stalk a woman he dated
SUMMARY: A Seattle, Washington, police officer who allegedly stalked a woman over a two-month period is under investigation. The officer is accused of using police equipment for stalking.

TITLE: West Virginia elementary school celebrates new therapy dog in ceremony
SUMMARY: A West Virginia elementary school welcomed a new therapy dog to the Friends with Paws program. Winnie, a female white labradoodle is the eighth therapy dog to be placed in the program.

TITLE: Large snowstorm spawns nationwide blizzards, tornadoes in South
SUMMARY: A nationwide storm system spawned multiple blizzards whose effects were seen as far south as the Gulf of Mexico, where tornadoes were spotted and flash flood warnings went into effect.

TITLE: Former Colorado social worker accused of filing false sex abuse report against councilwoman pleads not guilty
SUMMARY: Former Colorado social worker Robin Niceta pleaded not guilty to filing a false child sex abuse report against Aurora City Councilwoman Danielle Jurinsky.

TITLE: Man arrested in stabbing death of Eleanor Bowles, 77, killed in gated community in Atlanta
SUMMARY: A 77-year-old woman who lived in Atlanta's Buckhead neighborhood, Eleanor Bowles, was stabbed to death and suspect Antonio Brown is in custody, police say.

TITLE: West Virginia seeks to expand dilapidated buildings program
SUMMARY: West Virginia issued a survey asking leaders to expand a dilapidated buildings program. The survey will help officials decide which communities will receive funding.

TITLE: Colorado River Water Users Association to hold Las Vegas conference amid drought crisis
SUMMARY: Officials from California, Colorado, New Mexico, Utah, Wyoming, Arizona and Nevada will convene to address how states can reduce its Colorado River water consumption.

TITLE: 'Baby face killer' arrested after stabbing of 16-year-old girl in NYC apartment
SUMMARY: Zyaire Crumbley, 18, surrendered himself to police custody and faces charges for the alleged murder of his 16-year-old girlfriend in New York City's Harlem.

TITLE: Idaho murders: Captain recalls finding weeping friends, family at 'somber' crime scene
SUMMARY: Idaho captain Roger Lanier recalled Tuesday responding to the harrowing scene where four University of Idaho students were stabbed to death on the one-month anniversary of the murders.

TITLE: Hundreds of migrants use El Paso Airport as shelter amid holiday travel
SUMMARY: El Paso Airport is currently sheltering hundreds of migrants, as south Texas continues to struggle under the weight of the border crisis.

TITLE: New York City firefighters injured battling massive blaze at NYPD evidence station
SUMMARY: The FDNY responded to a 3-alarm fire at an NYPD evidence station in Brooklyn Tuesday morning, resulting in the injuries of three firefighters.

TITLE: 16-year-old student shot, injured outside a high school building in Portland
SUMMARY: A 16-year-old student was injured in a shooting in Portland, Oregon. The teen walked into a hospital with a non-life-threatening gunshot wound.

TITLE: San Francisco mandates teaching gender identity in elementary school: 'parental involvement not required'
SUMMARY: A San Francisco teaching guide is instructing educators to "explore integrating LGBTQ themes" in lesson plans while noting parental involvement is not required.

TITLE: WA man arrested after walking into courthouse with several rifles, bulletproof vest
SUMMARY: A man was taken into custody after walking into a Washington courthouse with rifles. He refused to put the weapons down when ordered by the officers.

TITLE: Infamous LA mountain lion who killed dog on leash is tranquilized, captured: 'Unprecedented situation'
SUMMARY: Officials said that the Southern California mountain lion P-22 had been captured on Monday before being transported to a wild animal care facility for evaluation.

TITLE: Thief caught on video stealing electric wheelchair; Maryland police offer $10K reward
SUMMARY: Police in Maryland are asking for the public's help in the search for a man who allegedly stole an electric wheelchair out of an apartment parking structure.

TITLE: Satanic Temple installs holiday display in Illinois capitol next to Nativity scene, menorah
SUMMARY: The Satanic Temple of Illinois installed a holiday display in the state's capitol rotunda, featuring a crocheted snake resting on a book written by Nicolaus Copernicus.

TITLE: Phoenix police officer accused of making porn while on duty using the name 'Rico Blaze'
SUMMARY: A Phoenix police officer is under investigation for reportedly recording and distributing pornography while he was on the clock working from home for the department.

TITLE: Sam Bankman-Fried, FTX founder, charged with fraud, money laundering
SUMMARY: The Justice Department disclosed the charges against against Samuel Bankman-Fried, the disgraced founder of the cryptocurrency exchange FTX.

TITLE: NYC spending $1M per month on private security guards at subway stations
SUMMARY: Metropolitan Transportation Authority officials say $1 million is being spent per month for security guards in an effort to combat fare evasion in New York City’s subway system.

TITLE: Ohio teenager sentenced to life in prison for murdering a man on a bus
SUMMARY: An Ohio judge sentenced Kavon Jackson to life in prison for the 2021 murder of William Howell, who Jackson shot 10 times while on a city bus. Jackson was 17 at the time.

TITLE: South Carolina detention officer fired after allegedly letting inmate kiss her and use cellphone
SUMMARY: South Carolina deputies say that a detention officer was fired after she allegedly let an inmate use her cellphone as well as kiss her.

TITLE: Missouri KFC customer shoots employee over corn outage
SUMMARY: A St. Louis, Missouri, KFC worker was shot after a customer became upset that the restaurant was out of corn, police said.

TITLE: Arizona border officers seize 1.5 million fentanyl pills over past week
SUMMARY: Border authorities in Arizona stopped eight loads carrying 1.5 million fentanyl pills in the past week, authorities said.

TITLE: Fort Stewart victim identified in fatal shooting at Georgia Army post
SUMMARY: The victim of a shooting at Fort Stewart, an Army Post in Georgia, has been identified as 30-year-old Sgt. Nathan M. Hillman of Plump, Pennsylvania.

TITLE: Idaho investigators focus on video, Hyundai Elantra in college murders probe
SUMMARY: Idaho investigators continue to gather surveillance footage and seek tips related to a white Hyundai Elantra seen near the crime scene around the time of the quadruple homicide.

TITLE: Russian, US nationals charged in elaborate war abetting machine on behalf of Kremlin
SUMMARY: Five Russian nationals and two US nationals have been charged in a global scheme procuring highly sensitive military equipment and technology for the Kremlin.

TITLE: Oregon police say 'nationwide arrest warrant' issued for man accused of murdering girlfriend
SUMMARY: Portland police said a "nationwide arrest warrant” has been issued for a man who allegedly murdered his girlfriend, saying they believe he left the area.

TITLE: Former US Marine pilot accused of conspiracy for training Chinese pilots
SUMMARY: A former Marine broke arms controls laws when he trained Chinese military pilots without permission, authorities said

TITLE: Idaho murders: Cops take hours of video from gas station after clerk spots white car on night of stabbings
SUMMARY: An Idaho gas station clerk says she found a white sedan on surveillance video taken on the night of a quadruple homicide nearby and sent it to police.

TITLE: Teacher at Catholic school for deaf children placed on leave after allegedly throwing student: 'Malicious act'
SUMMARY: A teacher in Evendale, Ohio, has been placed on leave after allegedly throwing a young girl at a Catholic school for deaf children, prompting outrage from the girl's mother.
